title: Is this e-mail legit?
body: leagueoflegends@email.riotgames.com can a rioter confirm if this e-mail is actually riot?

replies.body:
Hey Dream,

Firstly thanks for bringing this up. After a quick investigation (and from my general knowledge) I can't confirm 100% if that email is legit. Can you please forward it to me ToxicHawk@riotgames.com, I will be able to investigate further.

Now onto your question. I don't believe your account was compromised but to be safe you could reset your password to something that is completely different from your current one.
I suggest doing this on both your client and your email account. Just to ensure that no one can use the Forgot Password feature and reset your account password and email address.

If you have any further questions please let us know.

-ToxicHawk

The first thing to do is always be suspicious of weird emails! 

The email address you listed is what appears when we occasionally send out information about upcoming events.

**That said, people can make it appear that it comes from us when it isn't. **

If you're being asked for a password, username, personal information or to visit a site that isn't Leagueoflegends.com don't trust it!

My attitude to emails, regardless of what company it says, is suspicious until proven trustworthy. One of my old email addresses is spammed constantly by fake games company emails that are phishing for information.

Thanks for your reply, yes the e-mail is completely irrelevant and does not contain anything with regards to events hence why even after I saw it was a confirmed website I was suspicious because it says from riotgames instead of League of Legends the R is also not capitalized, hence why I thnought it was spoofed, I accidently clicke da link in the e-mail can you give me any recommendations on what I sh ould do to ensure my accounts are not hacked, I virus scanned yet it came up with nothing however I'm still suspicious
